column4: I'd like some help configuring Ubuntu for my external LCD. I have a Toshiba Satellite A205(15.4" WXVGA), Ubuntu 11.10, with a KOGi 17"-19" LCD Flat Screen.
Ubuntu currently allows only up to 1024x768, however this LCD has proven it can do 1280x1024.
I have just happily dealt with the similar problem, let me share a link. :)
Assuming, that you want to add an undetected resolution, you can find the complete instructions here: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Config/Resolution#Adding_undetected_resolutions
What are you trying to accomplish, anyway? Add a resolution that is not automatically detected?
If your driver is Nvidia, you simply can use it's utility, called «Nvidia X Server Settings» to change the resolution and write the changes to the configuration files.
It means that you have an integrated video card.
You will have to use xrandr, then.
I think I have already given you the link to the page with instructions, no? This one. https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Config/Resolution#Adding_undetected_resolutions
I don't think I understand you.
You was able to scroll 'the desktop itself'?
Then I do not quite understand the issue. Was the image stretched, or disproportionate?
You should not have been able to do it, unless something is wrong, or you deliberately set up the virtual resolution bigger than than the real.
Do you know for a fact, that your display can do 1280×1024?
